required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Real-world Evidence of COVID-19 Vaccines Effectiveness
clinical_study.official_title: Real-world Evidence of COVID-19 Vaccine Effectiveness Against COVID-19 Hospitalization: the Case-control Study in St. Petersburg, Russia

collaborator.agency: Medical Institute named after Berezin Sergey

clinical_study.source: St. Petersburg State Pavlov Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: This is an observational case-control study to evaluate COVID-19 vaccine effectiveness against hospitalisation with COVID-19 related conditions in St. Petersburg, Russia. Two sets of cases and control will be retrospectively analyzed to compare vaccination proportions and other characteristics to infer vaccine effectiveness from odds ratios. The first set of cases will be extracted from the data on hospitalisation of patients with COVID-19 to First Pavlov State Medical University of Saint-Petersburg hospitals, and controls will be patients hospitalised with other conditions. The second set of cases and controls will be based on patients referred to Medical Institute named after Berezin Sergey for computed tomography. Cases will be patients with positive SARS-CoV-2 status computed tomography confirmed pneumonia or patients referred to hospitalisation, and control will be patients without pneumonia and not referred to hospitalisation.

primary_outcome.measure: Effectiveness of full vaccination against hospitalization with COVID-19 pneumonia
primary_outcome.description: Full vaccination effectiveness is calculated based on the odds ratio of vaccination proportions in cases and controls, adjusted for other patient characteristics. Full vaccination status is assigned after two weeks of the second dose for each vaccine separately.

secondary_outcome.measure: Effectiveness of partial vaccination against hospitalization with COVID-19 pneumonia
secondary_outcome.description: Partial vaccination effectiveness is calculated based on the odds ratio of vaccination proportions in cases and controls, adjusted for other patient characteristics. Partial vaccination status is assigned after two weeks of the first dose for each vaccine separately.

secondary_outcome.measure: Effectiveness of vaccination against hospitalization with COVID-19 pneumonia in different age groups
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluate vaccine effectiveness in different age groups (<20, 20-29, 30-39, 40-49, 50-59, 60-69, >70)

arm_group.arm_group_label: Patients hospitalised to clinics of First Pavlov State Medical University of Saint - Petersburg
arm_group.description: 450 cases - patients hospitalised with COVID-19 450 control - patients hospitalised without COVID-19 in the same period (surgical, oncological, cardiological, ophthalmologic, gastroenterological departments)

arm_group.arm_group_label: Patients referred to Medical Institute named after Berezin Sergey for computed tomography
arm_group.description: Cases - patients with pneumonia confirmed after computed tomography. Controls - patients without pneumonia after computed tomography.

intervention.arm_group_label: Patients hospitalised to clinics of First Pavlov State Medical University of Saint - Petersburg
Patients referred to Medical Institute named after Berezin Sergey for computed tomography

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients hospitalized to clinics of First Pavlov State Medical University of Saint-Petersburg
- Patients referred to Medical Institute named after Berezin Sergey for computed tomography
- Available vaccination status
Exclusion Criteria:
- Refusal to provide information for research purposes at the time of hospitalization or reference to computed tomography

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: St. Petersburg State Pavlov Medical University
